New Records: England's net run-rate that was minus 1.800 before the match is now plus 3.08, ahead of Scotland's plus 2.164
Key Match Events: Adil Rashid took 4-11, Phil Salt clubbed the first two balls of the England innings over the long boundaries for sixes, Jos Buttler carried his bat to get England home with 101 balls to spare
Pre-Game Insights: Buttler won the toss and chose to bowl, theorizing that England would be in a better position to manage the run rate equation if it was chasing
Post-Match Reflections: Rashid said, “We played exceptionally well. At the top Woody and Jofra set the tone and I thought we bowled exceptionally well as a team to bowl them out for 47. It's always nice to bowl the first ball and to see it spinning.”

Buttler said, “Job done today and we've got another big game in two days time. I thought the tone was set really well by the bowlers who managed to pick up those early wickets and restrict them and knock them off”
Miscellaneous Highlights: England took a point from its first match against Scotland and was beaten by 36 runs by Australia
England will now play Namibia on June 16. Its qualification for the Super Eight stage is still dependent on the outcome of the other group match on June 16 between Australia and Scotland
Others: The match was played at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium in North Sound, Antigua and Barbuda
Jos Buttler of England hits 6 during the ICC men’s Twenty20 World Cup 2024 group B cricket match between England and Oman at Sir Vivian Richards Stadium
